SitesManager.AdvancedTimezoneSupportNotFound: Advanced timezones support was not found in your PHP (supported in PHP>=5.2). You can still choose a manual UTC offset.
SitesManager.AliasUrlHelp: It is recommended, but not required, to specify the various URLs, one per line, that your visitors use to access this website. Alias URLs for a website will not appear in the Referrers → Websites report. Note that it is not necessary to specify the URLs with and without 'www' as Ghost Metrics automatically considers both.
SitesManager.ChangingYourTimezoneWillOnlyAffectDataFo: Changing your time zone will only affect data going forward, and will not be applied retroactively.
SitesManager.CurrencySymbolWillBeUsedForGoals: The Currency symbol will be displayed next to Goals revenues.
SitesManager.DefaultTimezoneForNewWebsites: Default Time zone for new websites
SitesManager.DeleteConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete the website %s?
SitesManager.EcommerceHelp: When enabled, the "Goals" report will have a new "Ecommerce" section.
SitesManager.ExceptionDeleteSite: It is not possible to delete this website as it is the only registered website. Add a new website first, then delete this one.
SitesManager.ExceptionEmptyName: The website name can't be empty.
SitesManager.ExceptionInvalidCurrency: The currency "%1$s" is not valid. Please enter a valid currency symbol (eg. %2$s)
SitesManager.ExceptionInvalidIPFormat: The IP to exclude "%1$s" does not have a valid IP format (eg. %2$s).
SitesManager.ExceptionInvalidTimezone: The timezone "%s" is not valid. Please enter a valid timezone.
SitesManager.ExceptionInvalidUrl: The url '%s' is not a valid URL.
SitesManager.ExceptionNoUrl: You must specify at least one URL for the website.
SitesManager.ExcludedReferrersHelp: Enter the list of hostnames and URLs, one per line, you want to exclude from referrer detection.
SitesManager.ExcludedReferrersHelpDetails: Each entry needs to contain the hostname and may contain a path. If a path is provided a referrer will only be excluded if the path matches as well. URLs with and without 'www' are treated the same. Provided protocols will be ignored.
SitesManager.ExcludedReferrersHelpExamples: e.g. "%1$s" would match "%2$s" and "%3$s" but not "%4$s"
SitesManager.ExcludedReferrersHelpSubDomains: To also exclude all subdomains of a certain hostname, prefix it with a dot. e.g. "%1$s" would exclude "%2$s", but also all its subdomains like "%3$s".
SitesManager.GlobalListExcludedReferrersDesc: The hostnames and URLs below will be excluded from referrer detection.
SitesManager.GlobalExcludedUserAgentHelp1: Enter the list of user agents to exclude from being tracked by Ghost Metrics.
SitesManager.GlobalExcludedUserAgentHelp2: You can use this to exclude some bots from being tracked.
SitesManager.GlobalExcludedUserAgentHelp3: Regular expressions such as %s are supported.
SitesManager.GlobalListExcludedQueryParameters: Global list of Query URL parameters to exclude
SitesManager.GlobalListExcludedUserAgents: Global list of user agents to exclude
SitesManager.GlobalListExcludedUserAgents_Desc: If the visitor's user agent string contains any of the strings you specify, the visitor will be excluded from Ghost Metrics.
SitesManager.InstallationGuidesIntro: We provide step by step guides explaining how to embed the tracking code for some popular CMS and website builders:
SitesManager.ExtraInformationNeeded: To setup Ghost Metrics on your system, you may need the following information:
SitesManager.HelpExcludedIpAddresses: Enter the list of IPs, one per line, that you wish to exclude from being tracked by Ghost Metrics. You can use CIDR notation eg. %1$s or you can use wildcards, eg. %2$s or %3$s
SitesManager.JsTrackingTagHelp: Here is the JavaScript Tracking code to include on all your pages
SitesManager.KeepURLFragmentsHelp: If the checkbox below is unchecked, Page URL fragments (everything after the %1$s) will be removed when tracking: %2$s will be tracked as %3$s
SitesManager.KeepURLFragmentsHelp2: You can also override this setting for individual websites above.
SitesManager.KeepURLFragmentsLong: Keep Page URL fragments when tracking Page URLs
SitesManager.ListOfIpsToBeExcludedOnAllWebsites: The IPs below will be excluded from being tracked on all websites.
SitesManager.ListOfQueryParametersToBeExcludedOnAllWe: The Query URLs parameters below will be excluded from URLs on all websites.
SitesManager.ListOfQueryParametersToExclude: Enter the list of URL Query Parameters, one per line, to exclude from the Page URLs reports. Regular expressions such as %s are supported.
SitesManager.LogAnalyticsDescription: If the Javascript tracking method isn’t feasible, you can %1$suse server log analytics%2$s as an alternative method for tracking your website’s users.
SitesManager.MainDescription: Your Web Analytics reports need Websites! Add, update, delete Websites, and show the JavaScript to insert in your pages.
SitesManager.MobileAppsAndSDKsDescription: Not tracking a website? You can alternatively track a mobile app or any other type of application using one of the %1$savailable SDKs%2$s.
SitesManager.NoWebsites: You don't have any website to administrate.
SitesManager.OnlyOneSiteAtTime: You can only edit one website at a time. Please Save or Cancel your current modifications to the website %s.
SitesManager.PiwikOffersEcommerceAnalytics: Ghost Metrics allows for advanced Ecommerce Analytics tracking and reporting. Learn more about %1$s Ecommerce Analytics%2$s.
SitesManager.PiwikWillAutomaticallyExcludeCommonSessi: Ghost Metrics will automatically exclude the common session parameters (%s).
SitesManager.PluginDescription: Websites management lets you add a new website and edit existing websites.
SitesManager.SearchCategoryDesc: Ghost Metrics can also track the Search category for each internal site search keyword.
SitesManager.SearchCategoryParametersDesc: You may enter a comma-separated list of query parameters specifying the search category.
SitesManager.SearchKeywordParametersDesc: Enter a comma separated list of all query parameter names containing the site search keyword.
SitesManager.SearchParametersNote: Note: the Query parameters and Category parameters will be used only for websites which have Site Search enabled but left these parameters empty.
SitesManager.SearchParametersNote2: To disable Site Search for new websites, leave these two fields empty.
SitesManager.SelectDefaultCurrency: You can select the currency to set by default for new websites.
SitesManager.SelectDefaultTimezone: You can select the time zone to select by default for new websites.
SitesManager.SiteSearchUse: You can use Ghost Metrics to track and report what visitors are searching in your website's internal search engine.
SitesManager.SiteWithoutDataTitle: Only one last step to track your traffic with Ghost Metrics and gain valuable insights
SitesManager.SiteWithoutDataDescription: You need to add some extra code to your website or mobile app if you haven't already. Check your option below or %1$ssend all the instructions to a team mate%2$s.
SitesManager.SiteWithoutDataSetupTracking: Please set up the %1$stracking code%2$s below into your website or mobile app if you haven't already.
SitesManager.SiteWithoutDataMessageDisappears: This message will disappear as soon as some data is tracked for this website.
SitesManager.SiteWithoutDataChoosePreferredWay: Choose your preferred way of getting set up
SitesManager.SiteWithoutDataCloudflareDescription: You can use the Ghost Metrics App in Cloudflare to track data, follow the instructions from %1$sthis guide%2$s.
SitesManager.SiteWithoutDataCloudflareIntro: If you use Cloudflare, you can start tracking data in Ghost Metrics seamlessly using the Ghost Metrics App available in Cloudflare.
SitesManager.SiteWithoutDataCloudflareFollowStepsIntr: Follow these steps to set it up:
SitesManager.SiteWithoutDataCloudflareFollowStep02: Click "Websites" on the left menu, and select the site on which you want to enable the Ghost Metrics tracking code.
SitesManager.SiteWithoutDataCloudflareFollowStep04: Search for "Ghost Metrics" under the "Search Apps" input box.
SitesManager.SiteWithoutDataCloudflareFollowStep06: Click on "Preview on your site" button.
SitesManager.SiteWithoutDataCloudflareFollowStep07: Configure the app by specifying the Ghost Metrics URL and Site ID for which you want to enable tracking.
SitesManager.SiteWithoutDataCloudflareFollowStep09: Review permissions and allow Cloudflare to share your email address with Ghost Metrics by clicking "Continue".
SitesManager.SiteWithoutDataCloudflareFollowStep10: Wait for the app to install, and you will see the Ghost Metrics app installed under "Your Installed Apps" section.
SitesManager.SiteWithoutDataCloudflareFollowStepCompl: %1$sCongratulations!%2$s You have successfully installed the Ghost Metrics app on Cloudflare. To verify that hits are being tracked, visit your website and check that this data is visible in your Ghost Metrics instance.
SitesManager.SiteWithoutDataSinglePageApplication: Single-Page Application or Progressive Web App
SitesManager.SiteWithoutDataGhost MetricsTagManagerNo: Don't know what a Tag Manager is? Check out our %1$sTag Manager guide%2$s. If you are embedding multiple resources from 3rd party websites into your website, then tracking your website using the Tag Manager may be a better choice for you compared to using the regular JavaScript tracking.
SitesManager.SiteWithoutDataGoogleTagManagerDescripti: You can use Ghost Metrics with Google Tag Manager. To setup Ghost Metrics Tracking in Google Tag Manager, follow the instructions from this %1$sguide%2$s.
SitesManager.SiteWithoutDataSinglePageApplicationDesc: For Single-Page Application or Progressive Web App Tracking. Check out our %1$sguide%2$s.
SitesManager.SiteWithoutDataDetectedSite: We've detected you're using a %1$s site. Simply follow the instructions from this %2$sguide%3$s.
SitesManager.SiteWithoutDataDetectedSiteWordpress: We've detected you're using a Wordpress site. Simply %1$sfollow the instructions from this guide%2$s to install the %3$sWP-Ghost Metrics plugin%4$s.
SitesManager.SiteWithoutDataDetectedSiteWordpress2: Set up the WordPress plugin already and not seeing any data? Please check %1$sthis FAQ for help%2$s.
SitesManager.SiteWithoutDataDetectedGtm: We've also detected you're using a Google Tag Manager. If you prefer to set up Ghost Metrics using GTM please follow this %2$sguide%3$s.
SitesManager.SuperUserAccessCan: A user with Super User access can also %1$s specify global settings%2$s for new websites.
SitesManager.OnlyMatchedUrlsAllowed: Only track visits and actions when the action URL starts with one of the above URLs.
SitesManager.OnlyMatchedUrlsAllowedHelp: When enabled, Ghost Metrics will only track internal actions when the Page URL is one of the known URLs for your website. This prevents people from spamming your analytics with URLs for other websites.
SitesManager.OnlyMatchedUrlsAllowedHelpExamples: The domain and the path have to be an exact match and each valid subdomain has to be specified separately. For example when the known URLs are 'http://example.com/path' and 'http://good.example.com', tracking requests for 'http://example.com/otherpath' or 'http://bad.example.com' are ignored.
SitesManager.ChooseMeasurableTypeHeadline: What would you like to measure?
SitesManager.YouCurrentlyHaveAccessToNWebsites: You currently have access to %s websites.
SitesManager.DeleteSiteExplanation: Deleting a website will delete all log data that has been collected for it. This action is permanent and cannot be undone.
SitesManager.EmailInstructionsDocsPlainText: If you want to do more than track page views, please check out the Ghost Metrics documentation at %1$s.
SitesManager.EmailInstructionsGenerateTrackingCode: You can also generate a customized tracking code at %1$s.
SitesManager.EmailInstructionsSiteDetails: You will need these details to use the API or SDKs to track Ghost Metrics visits.
SitesManager.GADetected: %1$s was detected on your website. Did you know you can easily migrate your historical analytics data and settings from %2$s to Ghost Metrics? %3$s%4$s%5$sLearn more in this guide%6$s
SitesManager.GADetectedEmail: %1$s was detected on your website. Did you know you can easily migrate your historical analytics data and settings from %2$s to Ghost Metrics? Learn more here: %3$s
SitesManager.GTMDetected: Google Tag Manager was detected on your website. Did you know you can migrate your existing tags, triggers and variables from Google Tag Manager to Ghost Metrics Tag Manager? %1$sLearn more in this guide%2$s.
SitesManager.GTMDetectedEmail: Google Tag Manager was detected on your website. Did you know you can migrate your existing tags, triggers and variables from Google Tag Manager to Ghost Metrics Tag Manager? Learn more here: %1$s
SitesManager.CloudflareDetected: Cloudflare was detected on your website. Did you know you can use the Ghost Metrics app in your Cloudflare setup to track the website data? %1$sLearn more in this guide%2$s.
SitesManager.CloudflareDetectedEmail: Cloudflare was detected on your website. Did you know you can use the Ghost Metrics app in your Cloudflare setup to track the website data? Learn more here: %1$s
SitesManager.SiteWithoutDataGoogleTagManagerIntro: If you use Google Tag Manager, you can start tracking data in Ghost Metrics seamlessly using the "Custom HTML Tag" available in Google Tag Manager. %1$sLearn more%2$s.
SitesManager.SiteWithoutDataGoogleTagManagerFollowSte: Follow these steps to set it up:
SitesManager.SiteWithoutDataGTMFollowStep1: %1$sLogin%2$s into your Google Tag Manager account.
SitesManager.SiteWithoutDataGTMFollowStep2: Select the container that you want to add Ghost Metrics to.
SitesManager.SiteWithoutDataGTMFollowStep4: At the top of the window, provide a name for your tag.
SitesManager.SiteWithoutDataGTMFollowStep6: Copy the Ghost Metrics JavaScript Tracking code as provided below.
SitesManager.SiteWithoutDataGTMFollowStep7: Paste this JavaScript tracking code in the Tag Configuration HTML field.
SitesManager.SiteWithoutDataGTMFollowStep9: Select "All Pages" to fire the "Ghost Metrics tracking tag" on all of your pages.
SitesManager.SiteWithoutDataGTMFollowStep11: Publish your changes by clicking the "Submit" button and then the "Publish" button at the top right.
SitesManager.SiteWithoutDataGoogleTagManagerFollowSte: %1$sCongratulations!%2$s You have successfully installed the Ghost Metrics tracking code via Google Tag Manager. To verify that hits are being tracked, visit your website and check that this data is visible in your Ghost Metrics instance.
SitesManager.SiteWithoutDataWordpressDescription: You can use the Ghost Metrics easy WordPress plugin to track data, follow the instructions from this %1$sguide%2$s.
SitesManager.SiteWithoutDataWordpressFollowSteps1: Log in to your WordPress site as the administrator.
SitesManager.SiteWithoutDataWordpressFollowSteps2: In the left menu, Click on "Plugins" > "Add new" (if you can’t see the "Plugins" menu, then you can instead %1$sfollow these steps to insert the Ghost Metrics tracking code manually in your WordPress Theme files%2$s).
SitesManager.SiteWithoutDataWordpressFollowSteps3: Search for "Connect Ghost Metrics" in the Keyword field on the "Add Plugins" page.
SitesManager.SiteWithoutDataWordpressFollowSteps4: Click on "Install Now" next to the "WP-Ghost Metrics Integration (WP-Piwik)" plugin.
SitesManager.SiteWithoutDataWordpressFollowSteps5: Now that the plugin is successfully installed, click on "Activate".
SitesManager.SiteWithoutDataWordpressFollowSteps6: In the left menu, click "Settings" -> "WP-Ghost Metrics ".
SitesManager.SiteWithoutDataWordpressFollowSteps7: In the "Ghost Metrics Mode" dropdown, select the option "Self hosted (HTTP API, default)".
SitesManager.SiteWithoutDataWordpressFollowSteps8: In the "Ghost Metrics URL" text field, enter your Ghost Metrics URL.
SitesManager.SiteWithoutDataWordpressFollowSteps9: %1$sClick here%2$s to create a Ghost Metrics Auth token (%3$slearn more%4$s).
SitesManager.SiteWithoutDataWordpressFollowSteps11: Paste the Auth token in the “Auth token” field of the WordPress plugin.
SitesManager.SiteWithoutDataWordpressFollowSteps12: Confirm the "Auto config" checkbox is selected.
SitesManager.SiteWithoutDataWordpressFollowSteps14: You should see "WP-Ghost Metrics is successfully connected to Ghost Metrics" message. If you do not see the message, make sure the values you provided in the steps above are correct, and then try again.
SitesManager.SiteWithoutDataWordpressFollowSteps16: In the "Add tracking code" dropdown, select "Default tracking".
SitesManager.SiteWithoutDataWordpressFollowSteps17: Click on "Save Changes" and a success message will appear.
SitesManager.SiteWithoutDataWordpressFollowStepComple: %1$sCongratulations!%2$s You should now be successfully tracking visitors with Ghost Metrics through your WordPress site! Happy Analytics.
SitesManager.SiteWithoutDataWordpressFollowStepNote: Once you've completed the steps above, visit your website and generate a test visit. If you encounter this message, make sure you have the "%1$s" plugin installed.
SitesManager.SiteWithoutDataWordpressIntroductionLine: It’s easy to add Ghost Metrics tracking to your WordPress site with our simple plugin, you can follow the steps below or %1$sfollow this guide%2$s.
If you can’t (or choose not to) use a plugin, you can %1$sinstall the JavaScript code%2$s or %3$sinstall an image beacon%4$s to start tracking.
SitesManager.SiteWithoutDataWordpressRequirement2: WordPress.com site with a Business, Commerce or Enterprise plan, or a Self-hosted WordPress site.
SitesManager.SiteWithoutDataWordpressFollowStepsIntro: Steps to start tracking in Ghost Metrics
SitesManager.SiteWithoutDataStartTrackingDataDescript: Choose your preferred tracking method below. If you need help, you can share these %1$sinstructions via email%2$s or %3$sinvite another user%4$s for assistance.
Note: This screen will disappear as soon as some data is tracked for this website. Alternatively, you can %1$sclick here to hide this page for one hour%2$s.
SitesManager.SiteWithoutDataIgnorePage: Don't show this page for an hour
SitesManager.SiteWithoutDataVueDescription: You can use the "%1$s" npm package to integrate Ghost Metrics to track data, follow the instructions from this %2$sguide%3$s.
SitesManager.VueDetected: Vue.js was detected on your website. Did you know you can use the "%1$s" npm package to integrate Ghost Metrics into your site? %2$sLearn more in this guide%3$s.
SitesManager.SiteWithoutDataVueIntro: Tracking your Vue.js website or app is easy with Ghost Metrics, even for Single Page Applications.
SitesManager.SiteWithoutDataVueFollowStep2: Initialize %1$s in %2$s with your Ghost Metrics Instance details (example code below).
SitesManager.SiteWithoutDataVueFollowStep2ExampleCode: Configure your Ghost Metrics server and site by providing:
SitesManager.SiteWithoutDataVueFollowStepCompleted: %1$sCongratulations!%2$s You have successfully installed the Ghost Metrics tracking code via the "%3$s" npm package. To verify that hits are being tracked, visit your website and check that this data is visible in your Ghost Metrics instance.
SitesManager.SiteWithoutDataVueFollowStepNote1: Now you can access Ghost Metrics in your components through %1$s.
SitesManager.SiteWithoutDataVueFollowStepNote2: If you followed these steps and have no data coming into Ghost Metrics, you can try the %1$sGhost Metrics Tag Manager%2$s instead (use this link for %3$sSingle Page Applications%4$s).
SitesManager.VueDetectedEmail: Vue.js was detected on your website. Did you know you can use the "%1$s" npm package to track the website data? Learn more here: %2$s
SitesManager.MergedNotificationLine2: Learn more about configuring Ghost Metrics to work with these by following these guides: %1$s
SitesManager.ConsentManagerConnected: We’ve detected that %1$s is correctly configured to work with Ghost Metrics on your site.
SitesManager.SiteWithoutDataReactDescription: You can use the "%1$sGhost Metrics Tag Manager%2$s" to integrate Ghost Metrics to track data, follow the instructions from this %3$sguide%4$s.
SitesManager.ReactDetected: React.js was detected on your website. Did you know you can use the "%1$sGhost Metrics Tag Manager%2$s" to integrate Ghost Metrics into your site? %3$sLearn more in this guide%4$s.
SitesManager.ReactDetectedEmail: React.js was detected on your website. Did you know you can use the "Ghost Metrics Tag Manager" to track the website data? Learn more here: %1$s
SitesManager.SiteWithoutDataSPADescription: It is easy to start tracking your Single Page Application (SPA) or Progressive Web App (PWA) using Ghost Metrics. The easiest way to do this is using the Ghost Metrics Tag Manager (%1$slearn more%2$s) using the steps below, alternatively you can use the JavaScript Tracking code (%3$sfollowing this guide%4$s).
SitesManager.SiteWithoutDataSPAFollowStepCompleted: %1$sCongratulations!%2$s You have successfully installed the Ghost Metrics tracking code via the Ghost Metrics Tag Manager. To verify that hits are being tracked, visit your SPA / PWA and check that this data is visible in your Ghost Metrics instance.
SitesManager.OtherWaysTabDescription: Even if the solutions provided in the other tabs were not right for you, you can easily setup Ghost Metrics with one of the methods below. You may need the following information:
SitesManager.ImageTrackingDescription: When a visitor has disabled JavaScript, or when JavaScript cannot be used, you can use an image tracking link to track visitors. For the whole list of options you can use with an image tracking link, see the %1$sTracking API Documentation%2$s.
SitesManager.ImportDataFromGoogleAnalyticsDescription: Import your Google Analytics properties and reporting data to create a backup and analyse them using Ghost Metrics’s powerful analytics tools. Check out our %1$sguide%2$s.
